PARAGRAPH.STRING: , CB, DSO (August 16, 1888 - May 19, 1935), professionally known as T.E. Lawrence and, later, T.E. Shaw, but most famously known as Lawrence of Arabia, gained international renown for
role as a British liaison officer during the Arab Revolt of 1916 to 1918.
very public image was in some part the result of U.S. traveller and journalist Lowell Thomas's sensationalised reportage of the Revolt, as well as
autobiographical account, Seven Pillars of Wisdom.
